text: The Ichthyosporea (or DRIP clade, or Mesomycetozoea) is a group of microscopic organisms within the Opisthokont group. They are mostly parasites of fish and other animals. ==Terminology== The original name, ichthyosporea, described the first discovered species in the group (such as Sphaeroforma arctica). They were all parasites of fish. ==Phylogeny== Its main groups are Dermocystida and Ichthyophonida == References == Category:Parasites Category:Protista
title: Ichthyosporea
